title: Get a sneak peek at the new 'Peppa Pig' season premiering on Nick Jr.
text:
CLOSE "Peppa Pig" and her family embark on new mud-splashing adventures in a new season on Nick Jr. starting Oct. 4. USA TODAY

American kids will have another opportunity to pick up a British accent with an all-new season of "Peppa Pig."

The fun offically begins Oct. 4 at 8 p.m. on Nick Jr.

So what are Peppa, George, Mummy Pig, Daddy Pig and all of Peppa’s friends getting into this season?

Mud, of course!

In one sneak peek, the group goes to a festival where they, sing along now, "dance, dance, dance in muddy puddles, splish, splash, splosh, splish, splash!"

See track No. 10 from the newly-dropped "Peppa Pig" album. It's no "Baby Shark," but there are still plenty of lyrics to annoy, er, entertain your kids.

The "Peppa Pig" family sings and dances at at festival in a brand new season. (Photo: Peppa Pig)

They group also goes camping, only to discover their neighboring campmates are "glamping," which is "like camping but with home comforts."

They "glampers" settle in with a complete bathroom and TV, while Peppa's family squeeze into a tiny tent, right before a big rain.

"Peppa Pig" and her family go camping in a new season. (Photo: Peppa Pig)

We're not sure what happens next, but our best guess is there is more jumping in muddy puddles!

It looks like viewers will also get to see more of Mandy Mouse. The show made headlines in April for introducing the character who uses a wheelchair. Parents praised "Peppa Pig" creators for its inclusivity and positive representation of children with disabilities.

Squeak! Introducing the newest member of the playgroup, Mandy Mouse! 🐭 pic.twitter.com/cwMy8vFuVS — Peppa Pig Official (@peppapig) April 3, 2019

"Peppa Pig" also made headlines when a London fire station noted the show's use of sexist language when referring to Mummy Pig as a "fireman." The station prefers the term "firefighter," which isn't gender specific.

Catch all the new episodes each month on Nick Jr. when "Peppa Pig" takes over the channel's All-Star block from 5 p.m. to 10 p.m. New episodes will premiere then.
